description:
Ang paos aren't the only gifts you can give this Chinese New Year. 

Subscribe to ZilLearn Plus and share with your family and friends this festive season the convenience of online learning. One subscription plan at S$16.50 monthly unlocks access to more than 10,000 lessons to top workplace skills taught by industry experts. 

And in the spirit of giving, we will donate S$50 to any of our 12 community partners, each time they are nominated by a ZilLearn Plus subscriber. 

Visit plus.zillearn.com to know more.

Lap Mei Fun aka ËÖäÂë≥È•≠
.
This is one of my proud creation (for fundraising) for January using various wax meat from @goldenbridgefoodsofficial 
.
Mama had almost forgotten about this dish. Because the last time I had, it was nearly 20 years back. This dish is a must-have among Cantonese during CNY. And when mama proposed preparing it, everyone went ‚Äòhuh‚Äô? This shows that we are not Cantonese. 
.
Anyway, this dish has been around for a long time (during the pre-refrigeration era), and eaten whenever there‚Äôs an occasion. Meats are cured for months and when new year comes, it will be served as part of a festive dish. 
.
So mama is super nervous during the preparation. Not sure how it taste and look like; no reference to it expect for images found via internet.
.
This dish turns out a hit and beautifully cooked. The smell of cured meat with seaseme oil is a perfect combination! 
.
It‚Äôs not that difficult to prepare actually. Swipe left to view the recipe!! If you are cooking this dish rem to use Low sodium soy sauce from @leekumkeesg . The cured meats has its own salty and unique flavour. Hence you won‚Äôt want your rice too be too salty as well. 
.
On a side note, OST holding will pledge $20 if you cook with any of their Brands & products:
.
Golden Bridge
Kelly‚Äôs
GB Golden Lion
Orchid Brand
El-Dina
Kizmiq
.
All you need to do is upload a picture via YoRipe app and #cookforsgchildrensoccny2022 
.

description:
Thank you once again, from the bottom of our hearts. With your support, the Opening Night of Empowering The Artist In You: Ada and Anthony Art Exhibition was an incredible success! Together, we were able to raise $15,000 that will go towards supporting children and youth inneed. 

The exhibition will be open to the public and will run till March 22nd at Hiart Esplanade Gallery. Charity merchandise will be available for purchase at the Gallery Counter. 

All proceeds from the exhibition sale will be donated to the Singapore Children's Society

description:
Singapore Children's Society protects and nurtures children and youth of all races and religions. In 2020, the Society reached out to 34,654 children, youth and families in need. Established in 1952, its services have evolved to meet the changing needs of children.

Today, Singapore Children's Society operates more than 10 service centres islandwide, offering services in the four categories of: Vulnerable Children and Youth, Children and Youth Services, Family Services, and Research and Advocacy.

Do check out their website (www.childrensociety.org.sg), Facebook (SingaporeChildrensSociety), Instagram/Telegram/Twitter (@sgchildrensoc), and LinkedIn (Singapore Children's Society)!

Thank you to everyone who has supported this small biz in one way or another! From the very start of this clay acc back in Jul 2021, I‚Äôve always wanted to make this new hobby of mine meaningful. Besides creating and exploring designs, I also wanted to give back to the community. It started off with donations to @krsnasfreemeals  @hagarsingapore and @sgchildrensoc before settling on @sharethemeal where my heart truly lies - helping children (through food which we have abundance of here in SG). 
.
This is not the end!!! It‚Äôs just a break while I adjust to my new work schedule. I‚Äôll still be posting new things but I‚Äôll be less responsive on the website pls HMU on IG if I don‚Äôt respond / you don‚Äôt receive ur parcel within a week. 
.

description:
Who is the winner?

This November we are giving away a brand new and 100% Authentic Kate Spade Spade Link Mini Tote Pink Multi worth $278 & Coach Compact ID Wallet In Sport Calf Leather-Dark Saddle worth $168!!

We also asked everyone to share with us ‚ÄúWhat makes children so special?‚Äù and we have pick the TOP 3 Comments which are from @syasya101088 , @mohamed_ellias , @helloiamem and we would like you to choose the best comment for us! ü•∞ The comment with more votes will win our secret prize!! ü§©
*Please head over to our IG Story to vote 

üì£ Watch our Instagram livestream tomorrow to find out all the lucky winners!! üëÄ

‚ö†Ô∏èIMPORTANT‚ö†Ô∏è
Winner for our Giveaway must be present in our livestream to win!! Your prize will be forfeited to the next lucky winner if you‚Äôre unable to comply with this condition!

How we select the winner? 
We will pick the winner from our lucky draw box and the winner name will be announce, if he/she is not present in our livestream, we will pick again from our lucky draw box and continue to pick until we find the lucky winner!

*Other T&Cs Apply

[EXTENDED UNTIL 27 DEC] #ATDGingerbreadVillage üè°
 
This Christmas season, we are setting up a Toy Fund to raise money to buy educational supplies and essentials for kids from @sgchildrensoc who may not have their own place to call home but have a loving community to spend the holidays with üíïüéÑ
 
It takes a village to raise a child and on this occasion, we need your help to give these kids the gift of happiness.
 
For every Instagram post featuring our Gingerbread House Kit, we will be donating a percentage of the sales of our kit to the Toy Fund.
 
This is how you can participate:
1) Show us how you decorate, celebrate or enjoy our Gingerbread House Kit
2) Snap a photo or video and post it on Instagram using the hashtag #ATDGingerbreadVillage
3) A portion of the sales from the Gingerbread House Kit you purchased and posted about will be pooled into the Toy Fund
 
T&Cs:
üëâ only public IG profiles will be eligible
üëâ Posts should appear on the grid (not Stories) so that we can track the hashtags and entries at the end of the campaign
üëâ deadline of entries: Friday, 24 Dec 2021 at 12noon
 
About #SingaporeChildrensSociety:
Singapore Children's Society protects and nurtures children and youth of all races and religions. In 2020, the Society reached out to 34,654 children, youth and families in need. Established in 1952, its services have evolved to meet the changing needs of
children.
 
Today, Children's Society operates 12 service centres islandwide, offering services in the four categories of: Vulnerable Children and Youth, Children and Youth Services, Family Services, and Research and Advocacy.

JCI Mandarin concluded the online fundraising campaign for Singapore Children's Society, Make a Child Happy This Children's Day, with a cheque presentation session on 10 November 2021.

The committee was honoured to have met up with Singapore Children's Society's Chairman and JCI Senator Koh Choon Hui, DUBC, who was also 1968 JCI Singapore Past President.

JCI Senator Koh has shared many nuggets of wisdom on both his personal career and JCI journey - his mindset, his experience as well as his passion of contributing to society and to the next generation. The committee is grateful for the insightful session by JCI Senator Koh.

Huge thanks to Singapore Children's Society for presenting us with a token of appreciation, hand-drawn by one of their beneficiaries.

We quote from the movie, Zootopia (featured in the token of appreciation):

"No matter what kind of person you are, I implore you: Try. Try to make the world a better place. Look inside yourself and recognise that change starts with you."

Thank you for joining us to make a child happy this Children's Day.

@sgchildrensoc 
#jcimandarinsg #sgchildrensoc

2021 has certainly been a challenging year for everyone. Busy hawker centres were open only for takeaways, non-essential shops were shuttered, and offices were closed as working from home became the new normal. Travelling abroad became a massive challenge, with countries imposing restrictions on visitors to protect themselves from imported cases.

Therefore, Lussocitta have decided to help up those who are in need during this tough period. Join us in giving back to the vulnerable amongst us this November & December period.

From 9 November to 11 November, in conjunction with our 11.11 Sales, Lusso Citta will be donating $10 to Singapore Children‚Äôs Society for every purchase made on our website, Shopee and Lazada platform.

Content Warning: Mentions of Child Sexual Abuse 

We are grateful that Mdm President Halimah wrote about the issue of child sexual abuse‚Äîand in particular, abuse that happens within the home or family. She is right: we can definitely do more to protect children from sexual predators. 

Our stomachs churn too, when we read about such cases. That is precisely why we created our body safety division, Body Smarts Through Movement Arts, and why as dance artists, we integrate body safety principles within our dance performances and classes. We believe that the most important way to prevent child sexual abuse‚Äîto protect children from perpetrators, and from becoming perpetrators themselves‚Äîis to focus on early education about respect and boundaries. 

In this post, we share our approach to child sexual abuse prevention.

A terrible thing happened in Singapore‚Äôs literary industry. The recent news shed light on uneasy compromises and exploitations around a literary establishment. 

As a local author, it felt extremely uncomfortable learning about a literary establishment built on misconduct. My heart goes out to the people affected. 

As a mother, I fear that I don‚Äôt do enough to ùô•ùôßùô§ùô©ùôöùôòùô© my children from being victims and ùô•ùôßùôöùô´ùôöùô£ùô© my children from being perpetrators. 

I rely on a couple of books and programmes as resources to educate my children about body safety and protection against sexual abuse. @sgchildrensoc has a wealth of resources (KidzLive: I can Protect Myself programme, picture book, videos and handouts) for parents/caregivers to tap on. 

As a parent, I have to be hyper vigilant and proactive. 

More information on resources regarding this topic can be found in my highlight ‚ÄúSexual Abuse‚Äù.

#ReadingWithUmmi #BodySafety

description:
#ICYMI: Last Friday, we held our 5th Kopi Session ‚òï with over 61 community partners in attendance, including our Guest-Of-Honour, MOS and Adviser to Nee Soon GRC Grassroots Organisations, @muhammadfaishalibrahim!

The topic of discussion encompassed upcoming plans that our community partners have in their pipeline to further strengthen the support of our Yishun community. 

Through the breakout sessions, we saw how enthusiastic and thoughtful our community partners were in coming together to connect and collaborate for one another's causes and efforts. The Kampung Spirit really shone throughout the Kopi Session! üèò

We value how eager and ready our partners were in sharing their own resources to complement services of one another. Together, we can develop a robust caring ecosystem in town and continue to make Yishun a caring and inclusive home.

If your organisation wishes to make a difference in the Yishun community, do join our next Kopi Session in the following quarter! Please reach out to us by emailing Ms. Rebecca at rebeccathng@campusimpact.org.sg.

taggedFullName9: Let Our Voice Run by LCCS

description:
Trigger warning: Please note this article discusses instances of sexual assault and violence, including rape, molestation, harassment, child abuse‚Äîand its consequences, like depression and anxiety.

Sexual violence is a crisis in Singapore. We‚Äôve worked with Women Unbounded (@women.unbounded) to gather a sample of hundreds of news reports from 2017 to 2021, to produce Singapore‚Äôs first ever data story on this topic.

Thousands of victims are violated each year, and only a fraction of them ever share‚Äîlet alone report‚Äîwhat they‚Äôve been through. Unlike other crimes, victims bear the blame and shame that should be the perpetrators‚Äô. Victims face blame for where they go, how they look, and whom they interact with.

But the data shows that victims are hurt in spaces we‚Äôre all supposed to feel safe in, and in relationships inevitable in life. As a society, we need to do better. We need to go beyond the law and fundamentally rethink gender and sexuality. Through better education, media, and community care resources, we can and must change these attitudes and beliefs around sexual violence.

Link in bio.

9/9/2021 Editor's note: The story has been updated to amend a factual inaccuracy. The original version had stated that "Between 2017 and 2019, 9,200 cases involved the young and vulnerable". The correct range from the source, 2017-2020, is now reflected in the story.

--

#sexualassault #sexualviolence #sexualabuse #sexualharrassment #rapemyths #traumainformed #feminism #womensrights #singaporeüá∏üá¨ #metoo #genderequality #genderviolence #awareness #womenunbounded #datavisualization #datajournalism #dataviz #ddj #kontinentalist

caption: Photo by Towkay Food Channel in 210 Middle Road - SG Pools HQ with @sgchildrensoc. May be an image of one or more people, people standing and indoor.
description:
All children need nurturing care to develop their full potential - 

Right from birth, kids learn by playing and exploring in a safe and stimulating environment. Babies and young children learn best when they have a warm, engaged and responsive relationships with their main caregiver. Nurturing care encompasses young children‚Äôs need for good health, optimal nutrition, security and safety. And that‚Äôs what we want all children to receive. 

So this month, We decided to go with @sgchildrensoc to help children, youths and families in need. We want to help bring about relief and happiness and promote the well-being of the Child. Truth be told wouldn‚Äôt be able to do so without the help of everyone who has generously supported us thus far - you guys have been nothing short of amazing so kudos to all for doing something great ‚ù§Ô∏è

description:
What a show it was on Saturday night! 

Last weekend's All Stars e-Getai Charity Concert 2021 managed to raise $73,884 for Singapore Children‚Äôs Society and we are very grateful for the kind support and contributions from everyone. 

The funds raised will go a long way towards helping children, youth and families in need. The fundraising campaign will continue till 15 Sept 2021 and we strongly appeal for your continued support. You may donate directly to Children‚Äôs Society via PayNow by scanning the QR Code or keying in UEN S62SS0057G. Please indicate "hyperlive" under ‚ÄúBill Reference‚Äù.

Like, follow and share our Facebook and Instagram to be notified of the latest happenings on www.hyperlive.tv - we have a host of exciting shows lined up for you!

description:

This meaningful Getaway marks the official launch of the fundraising campaign for Singapore Children's Society @sgchildrensoc, with the theme, ‚ÄúMake a Child Happy this Children's Day!"

If you would like to make a tax-deductible donation now, head to https://g2c.childrensociety.org.sg/campaigns/jci-mandarin-make-a-child-happy and let's make a difference together this Children's Day. (Link in bio) #linkinbio

Can a cup of bubble tea you drink make a difference to a child in need?
 
Yes, it can.
 
Save the cost of 10 cups of bubble tea and help cover one month of pocket money for one child.
 
With sufficient pocket money, the child will never have to go hungry during lunch break in school.
 
Donate now at https://g2c.childrensociety.org.sg/campaigns/jci-mandarin-make-a-child-happy. Your donation qualifies for 2.5 times tax deduction. (Link in bio) #linkinbio
 
All funds raised will be directed to the general funds of Singapore Children‚Äôs Society.
 
Let's make a child happy together. Will you?
 
#jcimandarin #sgchildrensoc

Turn your cab ride savings into something impactful.
 
Save money by taking public transport and help cover one month of transportation costs for one child.
 
With transportation costs covered, the child can travel to school in a safe and efficient manner.
 
Donate now at https://g2c.childrensociety.org.sg/campaigns/jci-mandarin-make-a-child-happy. Your donation qualifies for 2.5 times tax deduction. Link in bio #linkinbio 
 
All funds raised will be directed to the general funds of Singapore Children‚Äôs Society.

#jcimandarin #sgchildrensoc

The visit to Singapore Children's Society (SCS) was an eye-opening one for me. Not all of us are blessed to grow and be nurtured in a safe home environment. The society is fortunate to have homes like Sunbeam Place @ Children‚Äôs Society to care for these children, regardless of race and religion,¬†lending them all the support that they‚Äôll need to be able to thrive in their growing-up years.

Recently, I had the opportunity to partner with PayPal for their #PayPalGiveBack campaign, and with the help of CHARLES & KEITH, we put a smile on some these children‚Äôs faces through these goodie bags lovingly packed by @CharlesKeithOfficial.¬†

Additionally,¬†@CharlesKeithOfficial¬†has made a donation to @sgchildrensoc ‚Äòs corporate giving programme, 1000 Enterprises for Children-in-Need (1000E) . All funds to the programme will be used to support Singapore Children‚Äôs Society and the programmes and services across SCS's 12 service¬†centres islandwide.

We can also do our part and contribute whenever we can‚Äîfor example, if you create a @paypal Singapore account, and shop online at¬†@CharlesKeithOfficial, @bedandbasics, and many other merchants, PayPal will donate 3% of your purchase to SCS. It makes me so happy to know that we can do¬†good when we shop! Visit¬†http://paypal.com/sg/givebackMM¬†to find out more.¬†

#CharlesKeithOfficial #ad

Everyone deserves a safe, comfortable place to call home‚Äîthis is what BEDANDBASICS and I believe, and something which I got to experience firsthand as part of the #PayPalGiveBack campaign.

In support of Singapore Children‚Äôs Society (SCS), the @bedandbasics team has carefully curated a set of furniture that will be donated to one of SCS‚Äôs beneficiaries who will soon be leaving Sunbeam Place @ Children‚Äôs Society to be reunited with family.

Although I didn‚Äôt get to meet the children of SCS due to the heightened restrictions, I was happy to visit the BEDANDBASICS warehouse to prepare the items to be delivered to the beneficiary. It was also inspiring to visit Sunbeam Place @ Children‚Äôs Society, a residential home and gazetted place of safety for children who have been abused and neglected.

I am truly grateful to SCS for running Sunbeam Place @ Children‚Äôs Society for these children, and to BEDANDBASICS for supporting children in need. If you‚Äôd like to help @sgchildrensoc, head over to the @bedandbasics website‚Äîand, if you‚Äôve signed up for a PayPal Singapore account, when you shop on @bedandbasics, @charleskeithofficial, and many other merchants, @PayPal will donate 3% of every purchase to SCS. 

Visit http://paypal.com/sg/givebackAS to find out more. 
 
#ad

description:
JOIN US as we pledge 10% of our Merlion sales to support our children at the Singapore Children‚Äôs Society. 

To donate, simply
1) select either 1 set (consist of 1 Big + 1 Small Merlion) @ $150, or 1 Big Merlion @ $98, or 1 Small Merlion @ $68. 
2) PayNow to UEN 201729872Z
3) Indicate your name as reference 
4) Send a screenshot of payment to our contact number (65) 9018 0320 
5) Our staff will contact you to liaise on colours available. First come first served basis.

Meanwhile, a huge thank you to those who have came forward to lend your support. 

For more information, contact us at (65) 9018 0320 today.

May be an image of text that says 'Campus Impact SG Cares Volunteer Centre @Yishun through Networking Sessions Organised Donation Launch SG Yishun April2021 WE ARE ONE Cheers to our volunteers and community partners having journeyed with the past year. MY Supporting Ground-Up To many more years fostering spirit volunteerism and making Yishun greater together! Equipping'.
description:
üéâ We celebrate our FIRST birthday this August! üéâ

We won't be here today celebrating this milestone without the support and trust of many of our stakeholders.

From not being sure of how the SG Cares Volunteer Centre (VC) @ Yishun could support their needs, to slowly building rapport and establishing credibility, we're indebted to their faith in us, and we remain grateful for having all of you journey with us the past year.

Together with our volunteers, donors, community partners, including beneficiaries, we also enjoyed fostering the Kampong Spirit by coming together to learn the ropes from one another to complement services, and as a SG Cares VC @ Yishun, learning more ways than one to better meet the needs of the community.

Through the various engagement and experiences shared, we hope to continue and strengthen the ties that bond us, and make Yishun a more caring and inclusive home for all.

Let's make Yishun greater together! üí™

#SGCares

caption: Photo shared by Safe Circle on August 02, 2021 tagging @sgchildrensoc, and @vox.44cc. May be an image of one or more people, people standing, wrist watch and eyeglasses.
description:
I lost my dad to cancer but had a mum who parented with a delicate balance of autonomy and boundaries. Some friends kept a distance when I was no longer upbeat and fun to talk to, but others stuck with me even when I was down and burdensome to be with. There were colleagues who deemed me unruly, but others that made me feel like my willingness to push boundaries is a strength and driving force for innovation and breakthroughs.
.
Trauma comes in so many forms. A marriage breakdown. Losing a loved one 2 illness. Feeling abandoned by someone we love. When I was a youth, asking 4 help was at times difficult. Will my friends think I'm weak? Will my parents be disappointed? If I did something in my moment of frustration, will my teachers seek to support, or merely to punish? My experience as a youth led me to become a youth worker, as I sought to become the person that youths could turn to. That's also why @vox.44cc , a youth centre under the umbrella of @sgchildrensoc , was set up as a space for youths to thrive with our workers in good times, and ride together through the bad times. 
.
The good news is, support could come in many forms too.

You can be that person of support too. @safecircle.sg is a place that gives you a glimpse in2 what trauma looks. It also provides complimentary trauma informed care workshops to get you started on how we can be that source of support that helps to prevent trauma from manifesting into mental health issues. Let's get it. =)
.
.
Thank you Wei Liat for your words and impactful work with VOX and @sgchildrensoc
.
#safecirclesg #youth #mentalhealth #trauma #socialwork #TIC

caption: Photo shared by Malaque Mahdaly on July 30, 2021 tagging @charleskeithofficial, @paypal, and @sgchildrensoc. May be an image of 2 people, people standing, headscarf and outdoors.
description:
My dearest girl here means the world to me. She lights up my life with her laughter and easy-going nature. She really taught me to be a lil more forgiving and that happiness is in the little everyday things.¬†

She gave me a new purpose in life that sparked my journey to be healthier and more energetic as I grow older every day, so that I can spend more precious quality time with her and her brother.

Speaking of purpose, @charleskeithofficial came up with the Purpose Collection as seen on both of our feet. Thoughtfully made with materials that are kinder on our planet, these are shoes that will not only make a fashion statement, but also express an eco-conscious stance. They are also made of 85% earth-friendly materials, including organic chemical-free cotton and certified recycled thermoplastic rubber.¬†

If you're passionate about giving back, whether it's to the earth or to society, we can also help to give back to the needy children that Singapore Children‚Äôs Society supports.

Sign up for a @PayPal Singapore account, and when you shop on CHARLES & KEITH‚Äôs website (children‚Äôs shoes included), @paypal will donate 3% of your transaction to @sgchildrensoc . This is such a sweet gesture. Just imagine the smiles on the children‚Äôs faces. :)

Shop at many other merchants, including @bedandbasics to give back! Visit paypal.com/sg/givebackMM to find out more.

#PayPalGiveBack #ad
#CharlesKeithOfficial #CharlesKeithGabine

caption: Photo by Aakarshana Saravanan in Singapore, Singapore with @paypal, @sgchildrensoc, @bedandbasics, and @nuloft. May be an image of 1 person, child, standing and indoor.
description:
As parents, the well-being of our children is our utmost priority, and we are constantly looking at ways to improve it. Sleep plays a very important role in ensuring our children‚Äôs overall well-being. Did you know that school-aged children should receive 9 to 11 hours of sleep at night, in order to be active and alert in the day? According to a study done in 2013, only about 9% of children were getting the rest that they need.
 

Just like us, Singapore Children‚Äôs Society (SCS) is committed to promoting the well-being of children, including their mental well-being. Children‚Äôs Society provides various services to support, nurture, inspire, protect, and strengthen children, youth, and families in need. The Society also conducts research to gain a better understanding into the well-being of children, youth and families, and advocates for changes based on some of these findings.
 

They need our help, and I am thankful for this opportunity to be working with PayPal and BEDANDBASICS for their #PayPalGiveBack campaign, which supports SCS‚Äôs mission of helping children of all backgrounds. Sign up for a @PayPal Singapore account, and when you shop online with @BEDANDBASICS, and many other merchants like @charleskeithofficial, @paypal will donate 3% of every purchase to @sgchildrensoc.

Visit paypal.com/sg/givebackAS to find out more.
 
#ad

COVID has made it so hard 2 stay connected. A shoulder 2 lean on, someone 2 laugh with or even just going 2 our favorite place 2 take our mind off things. The things we need 2 stay sane r  such precious commodities now.
.
.
Let's build a space together for ourselves and fellow youths. Play catching. Have a virtual picnic. Talk 2 our social workers if u r having an off day. Be each other's guardian 4 our mental well being. Join us n your friends too. Link in link tree URL on our bio. Let's ged 2Gather =) 
.
.
#youth #mentalhealth #virtual #dropin #support #sgunited

This is a period of indescribable trauma. No words can encapsulate how deeply saddened we are. Our hearts and love are with the family, friends, teachers and community in grieving this unimaginable loss. 

To anyone directly or indirectly affected by recent events, please know that you are not alone. We are here for you, as is the community around us. We hold this space for you to be and heal. 

Our podcast platform is open to anyone who would like a safe space to talk through any and all thoughts. Also included here are other avenues for healing and help. Please feel free to peruse these resources and reach out to us. 

#thetrulyotherpodcast #singapore #mentalhealth #mentalhealthawareness #mentalhealthmatters

caption: Photo by Pooja Kawatra |TheMums&Babies in Singapore, Singapore with @mercurysocial, @sgchildrensoc, @we.are.limitless, @accesets, @calsingapore, @campuspsy.sg, @boystownsg, and @safecircle.sg. May be an image of 1 person and indoor.
description:
Have you ever felt that you are struggling with your feelings?? Keeping a smile on your face but a lot going inside??

Mental health is something we all speak about once something unfortunate has happened & keep stressing to speak out our hearts but we need someone who can sit, talk to us, assure us and not judge us for what we are going through at the moment.

Childhood trauma, depression, Sexual abuse is on the rise and almost 64% of people of Singapore have experienced a traumatic event during the first 18 years of their lives. 

Most of the time people are so confused to talk about it. 

Seven local agencies focusing on community-based mental health services for children and youth - Acceset, Boys‚Äô Town, Campus PSY, Caregivers Alliance Limited, Limitless, Singapore Association for Mental Health, and Singapore Children‚Äôs Society - have come together to launch Safe Circle. 

@safecircle.sg is a platform that aims to shed light on the different forms of trauma. For anyone who would like to find out more about trauma-informed care, Safe Circle offers complimentary programs and workshops as well! 

For anyone out there reading this, who needs a listening ear or looking for a platform that helps in coping with any form of trauma, @SafeCircle.SG is here for you. 

Just to tell you that YOU are not ALONE in this.. 

#SafeCircleSG #poojakawatra

Superheroes need their superheroes too

Why do we love superheroes so much? I like to think it‚Äôs because we all need a bit of rescuing from time to time. Whether you were bullied at the playground or workplace, or experienced extremes of severe trauma in your life, we had all encountered ordeals where we wished we had been rescued. But superheroes need rescuing too - they face grief, personal tragedies, moral dilemmas and no-win scenarios - but they also show us how we can cope in the face of insurmountable odds. 

I am no superhero, despite the hashtag #docbydaysuperherobynight I wish I were - but no amount of gamma radiation, or superhuman serum, is going to turn me into one. I use humour as my "superpower" though - as I firmly believe that laughter is the best medicine. 

But trauma is no laughing matter.

I recently learnt that two-thirds of people in Singapore have experienced at least one traumatic event during the first 18 years of their lives, and that in 2020, @msfcares handled significantly more child abuse cases compared to the preceding 6 years. Growing up with considerable trauma can cause them to project these negative emotions into their own actions - most times at a subconscious level. It is thus on us as a caring society to be aware of these trauma and how it can impact on the community‚Äôs mental health. We must better identify the at-risk population by being more trauma-informed, in order to provide support to these victims, or to direct them to seek professional help.

Remember. Clowns cry too, and sometimes the widest grins can hide the saddest tears. These persons could be anyone around you. And it might even be you. 

@SafeCircle.SG (https://www.safecircle.sg ) comprises 7 local agencies that focus on community-based mental health services for children and youths. The platform provides help in coping with trauma, and also equips us with the resources to offer help to someone in need. As a parent, educator, helping professional or even just a concerned peer, check out their complimentary programs and workshops to integrate trauma-informed care into our work and lives. 

#SafeCircleSG

caption: Photo shared by Tjin Lee on July 18, 2021 tagging @sgchildrensoc, @we.are.limitless, @samhsingapore, @accesets, @calsingapore, @campuspsy.sg, @boystownsg, and @safecircle.sg. May be a closeup of one or more people.
description:
When I was 16, I watched a classmate get bullied, and out of fear, did not intervene. Worse, under peer pressure, I participated in being unkind to her. Being bullied can invoke feelings of helplessness, humiliation, depression, and may have a long-lasting impact on a child‚Äôs life. I often wonder what has happened to that young girl, and that shame has stayed with me for 30 years.
.
Singapore has the third highest rate of bullying globally. Statistics on school bullying in Singapore in a survey by @sgchildrensoc show that 1 in every 5 primary school students was a victim of bullying. 

Apart from bullying, there are many kinds of trauma that can affect us growing up. Some are obvious, like sexual or physical abuse, domestic violence, others are less obvious, like emotional abuse or neglect, cyber-bullying, or even a child overhearing frequent, intense arguments between his or her parents.
.
How can we help? We can learn to identify the symptoms of trauma, and seek help with trauma-informed care for ourselves or others. 
.
@safecircle.sg is a platform made up of seven mental health organisations in Singapore @samhsingapore @campuspsy.sg @accesets @calsingapore @we.are.limitless @boystownsg @sgchildrensoc that aims to shed light on the different forms of trauma, and offers complimentary programs and workshops on trauma-informed care.
.
Thirty years later, I will not be a bystander again. Let‚Äôs get the conversation going and encourage help-seeking behaviour. We can all do our part in keeping others safe ‚ù§Ô∏è #SafeCircleSG 
.
#mentalhealthawareness #mentalhealthmatters #trauma #traumainformed #sgunited #youcansitwithus #bullyfreesg #raisekindkids #sgmummy #sgmums

Even the strong, happy and confident ones amongst us may be hiding emotional scars sustained in our youth. Even the bully, oppressor and perpetrator could have adverse childhood experiences that contributed to their manifestations. 

Trauma comes in many forms and traumatic events include anything from being bullied in school, parental divorce, sudden loss of a loved one, witnessed or experienced domestic violence, to sexual harassment or abuse.

I was quite stunned to find out that nearly 64% of people in Singapore have reported experiencing at least one traumatic event during the first 18 years of their lives. It is also worrying to read that in 2020, @msfcares handled 44.6% more child abuse cases compared to 6 years before. 

Growing up with trauma can cause victims to project their trauma unto their actions. Hence, it is important for us as a society to be aware of trauma and how it relates to mental health. Being more trauma-informed, we can then better identify the vulnerable population, provide support and care to distressed victims, or encourage them to seek professional help if needed. 

@SafeCircle.SG (https://www.safecircle.sg ) comprises 7 local agencies that focus on community-based mental health services for children and youths. The platform provides help in coping with trauma, and also equips us with the resources to offer help to someone in need. As a parent, educator, helping professional or even just a concerned peer, check out their complimentary programs and workshops to integrate trauma-informed care into our work and lives. 

#SafeCircleSG #mentalhealth #psychologicalhealth #emotionalhealth #mentalhealthsupport #mentalwellness #mentalwellbeing #emotionalwellness #trauma #mentaltrauma #psychologicaltrauma #childhoodtrauma #adversechildhoodexperiences #childabuse #traumainformed #traumainformedcare #traumaawareness #traumahealing #selfcare #feelsafe #peersupport #helpinghand

@accesets @boystownsg @campuspsy.sg @calsingapore @we.are.limitless @samhsingapore @sgchildrensoc @mercurysocial

If you‚Äôve been ü§î to yourself ‚Äúhow on earth am I going to keep the kiddos entertained this summer break?‚Äù we‚Äôre here to help with a brand new selection of beautiful puzzles, paint by numbers kits, origami sets, our ever-popular giant Singapore colouring posters, and various activity books, all available in the boutique now!
.
These fun and creative ways to pass some time also help develop your children‚Äôs problem solving and creative skills. So you can feel good knowing they‚Äôre occupied doing positive things and everyone enjoys the summer break, even if it‚Äôs üåß like today!
.
We only have a limited number of each of these, so stop by this weekend or DM us if you‚Äôd like to pick some up! Happy Saturday everyone! üòä

description:
[just in] The number of young children who need mental health care is on the rise ‚Äî Even before the pandemic, children have been struggling with bullying, abuse and other undiagnosed mental health conditions. But now with COVID-19, there are even more stressors.
.
Interviews with mental health providers and data from hospitals across the country reveal that while providers are continuing to see a surge in teenagers visiting the emergency room for mental health problems, the number of children in crisis under the age of 13 is also on the rise, and has been for years.
.
Learn more at the article via CNA Lifestyle @ https://cnalifestyle.channelnewsasia.com/wellness/mental-health-kids-suicide-15120448
.

My friend gave me the idea of uploading all his postcards into this account so as to document all his hand-drawn pictures on this @craftndoodles account. 

I started this joint initiative with my son when he was 5 years old. He hand - drew and coloured a series of 15 postcards. I realised many people don't receive physical cards anymore and I thought it will be a nice initiative to roll this out to encourage people to write and send cards of encouragement to their loved ones. 

Thanks to everyone's kind support, his sale of postcards generated a total of $472 to the underprivileged children at @sgchildrensoc in 2018. 

My son is into digital drawing and animation now, his account is @lpencilstudio. üòä Hope you can support him there too. 
Hope we have the chance to do another initiative again soon.

#charity #gooddeed #postcard #drawings #childrenimagination #handdrawn

description: The Singapore Children‚Äôs Society provides a safe place for kids who face difficult family backgrounds including total neglect, abuse and parents in incarceration.  It is our hope that a small gesture can bring a song to their hearts, a smile to their faces and the hope that they have a better future ahead of them üôÇüôÇüôÇ

For our concert, we are supporting Singapore Children's Society (SCS) @sgchildrensoc, which aims to protect and nurture children and youth of all races and religions. 

In 2020, 34,654 children, youth and families benefited from SCS‚Äôs comprehensive range of programmes and services aimed at addressing different needs. 

Today, SCS operates 12 service centres islandwide, offering services in the 4 categories of: Vulnerable Children and Youth, Children and Youth Services, Family Services and Research and Advocacy. 

If you would like to know more about SCS, do visit their website, which can be found in our bio! üòÉ

description:
‚úîÔ∏è It is very important for children to have good mental health üß† 

üåü Positive mental health is essential for a child‚Äôs healthy development & for their growth.

„Ä∞Ô∏è During this pandemic, children might suffer from anxiety, panic attacks, depression or other forms of mental health abnormalities that can cause them to behave in odd ways..

If you notice a child behaving in a different manner that is of concern, please ask him/her quality questions that will help them express themselves first...

üëç The first step is to show that you truly care and give them a listening ear..

Have a heart to heart conversation and see how you can help them.

If the conditions worsens, please bring them to a child psychologist or for counselling first before resorting to medications or treatments immediately.

üíõ Compassion, empathy, affection could be what the child needs.

description:
<Change in timing!>

Traders, investment bankers or financial planners? What‚Äôs that? Ever wondered what people in the finance industry do? Come join us later at 5.30pm on our Virtual Drop-In Centre (VDIC) with our special guest, Nicole Ong @niqohlvictoria from Singapore Social (Netflix) to learn about what she does in her job and some of the challenges that she faces at work.

Link in bio!

I was honoured to be invited to share my personal experience and journey as a Professional Esports Player with VOX @ Children's Society.

A youth drop-in centre focusing on preventive and developmental needs through healthy recreational activities in which fun and social work intersect. VOX reaches out to youth aged between 13 to 18, underpinned by the Positive Youth Development framework to build on 5Cs - Confidence, Connection, Character, Competence and Caring. 

At the time, they were having an in-house tournament for Mobile Legends and youths were enthusiastic to ask me questions in hopes to seek advice to improve their gaming strategies. 
Apart from sharing my experiences of being a professional player and in-game knowledge, I wanted to highlight the positive aspects of gaming alongside the transferable skills that you are able to cultivate through gaming.

One lucky youth received the upcoming EVOS Esports Singapore Team's Jersey and I was glad to hand out some mask souvenirs from the M2 tournament through a mini quiz session as well.

In spite of the challenges faced by COVID-19, I hope the drop-in centres will continue to promote the positive development in children and youth.

As we grow more interconnected in a digitalised world, #creatingcohesivecommunities also means using our online spaces more wisely and respectfully.

Swipe left to learn some tips on on how we can generate more positive digital footprints in our own lives and those in our social networks!
--

Let's talk about it: Eating Disorders (EDs) 

How much do you know about EDs? In today's post, we concise some information that gives you some insights into EDs and the help available in Singapore! 

EDs are commonly a form of behaviour used to cope with feelings and emotions that are overwhelming.  Early intervention is the key to recovery. You are never too young, too old or too manly to seek help.

Have a personal experience you want to share to encourage others? Comment down below. 

Donate for a good cause, link in bio

üí• Happy 2021! üí•

Back in Nov 2020, I had a longing to pass on the love and support to the community around me. 

With your great support, kindness and generosity, together, we raised $222.07 in just 2 short months. Every single contribution, big or small has made a difference.

Let me know if you guys have an organisation that you're passionate about. Let's continue to spread the love. ‚ù§ 

#crochetbyjois
üß°

Thank you all for you generous donations! We raised over $800 for @sgchildrensoc and made many kids smile üíñ 

Blessed Christmas to all and may we continue to give, freely as we have received üíù

#mamakrisbakes #youdonateibake #donationdrive #christmas

Merry Christmas everybody! Christmas is the Season of Giving. In 2020, Inter Rice Asia has adopted Singapore Children's Society as our charity organisation.  Due to your overwhelming support at our recent Pre-Christmas Warehouse Sale, we managed to raise a total of $960. We also received $490.79 in donations over the last 9 months on our website, which we matched and rounded up the donations to $2000. A big THANK YOU for making this happen. Moving forward into 2021, we want to increase our support to help the Children of Singapore and bring smiles to them beyond the festive season. 

Cheers, 
from the team at theartofsake.com.

#interriceasia #charityevent #sgfundraising #singaporechildrensociety #sgchristmas

Introducing A Kinder Beauty...‚Å†
‚Å†
I'm happy to bring you another Singapore home-grown based e-tailer founded by beauty junkies (just like us!)‚Å†
‚Å†
AKB brings in vegan or vegan-friendly beauty brands that works, without the nasties. They believe in making conscious decision towards a kinder living, from their choice of 100% reusable and recyclable packaging to the launch of their own Kinder Tote.‚Å†
‚Å†
This year, they are working with Singapore Children's Society for fund-raising initiatives. 100% proceeds from sale of the Kinder Tote (painted by a beneficiary of Children's Society) + 2% of nett sales from AKG SG from 17 Nov to 31 Dec 2020 will be donated to SCS. I have linked their website in my bio, Go check them out and support @akinderbeauty and @sgchildrensoc this holiday! ‚Å†
‚Å†
Give and you shall receive. No act of kindness is too small and a little goes a long way.‚Å†
‚Å†
P.S. My review of the products will be in another post. Stay tuned, ok?‚Å†

description: Please buy the book, ‚ÄôCovi, the little Christmas dinosaur‚Äô - it just received a glowing 5-star review in What's Good to Read. And it is selected ‚ÄôBook of the Week‚Äô in My Baba.Com (What's Hot This Week). In Singapore, we are working with the Singapore Children's Society on ‚ÄôGive a Child a Book‚Äô, a campaign to encourage everyone to buy the book and donate it to a child who cannot afford it. The book is out on Amazon and for sale in Singapore. Full details on the link in my bio.

Perfect for Christmas! Our eagerly anticipated book for children is on sale in Singapore, yay! ‚ÄôCovi, the little Christmas dinosaur ‚Äô book sees the lovable dinosaur turn hero to help Santa deliver presents to children during the pandemic when the whole world is locked down. We love a brave hero! Featured in the book is a real-life hero, Harmonie-Rose Allen. You can buy the book for yourself, friends, and family or donate to the child that cannot afford it through our ‚ÄôGive a Child a Book‚Äô programme with @sgchildrensoc. Find out more on the link in our bio #childrensbooks #childrensbookillustration #dinosaurs #fairytale #christmas

@uniqlosg will be doing their distribution drive again this year at #VOX on 23 Dec. Open to all youths 13-18 and their family. Swipe left and scan the QR code to register. Limited to 8 people for every time slot. Bring your friends and family to pick some pre-loved garments. DM us if you‚Äôre have any questions #uniqlo #uniqlosg #uniqlodistributiondrive #voxyouthcentre #singaporechildrensociety #sgchildrensociety

Perfect for Christmas! Our eagerly anticipated book for children is out and it is on sale in Singapore and on Amazon.co.uk. ‚ÄôCovi, the little Christmas dinosaur‚Äô book sees the lovable dinosaur turn hero and help Santa deliver presents during the COVID-19 pandemic when the whole world is locked down. We love a brave hero! Will you buy a book to give to a child who cannot afford it? Click on the link in the bio to learn more. #childrensbooks #dinosaurs #fairytale #christmas #christmasgifts

caption: Photo shared by Mama Kris Bakes on December 10, 2020 tagging @sgchildrensoc.
description:
Come join us for our first #donationdrive - YOU DONATE, I BAKE! 

We may be a little late for #GivingWeekSG but it‚Äôs never too late to give! ‚ù§ Join us as we raise funds and share some yummy bakes this Christmas! We have donated our collection from the 30
DIY sets so now‚Äôs your turn!

From now till 20 December 2020, for every $10 donation made directly to Singapore Children‚Äôs Society by our followers, we‚Äôll bake 4 cookies for the beneficiaries under their care. 

Here‚Äôs how you can show some love:
1) Donate directly to @sgchildrensoc (tinyurl.com/beoursanta)* 
2) Comment or DM us a screenshot of your donation and we will get baking! 
 
On 22 December 2020, we will surprise the children with those cookies and bring some festive cheer to them and their families ‚ù§

Who‚Äôs in? 

Thank you for your generosity! 
 
*IG link in bio 
 
#mamakrisbakes #youdonateibake #sgchidrensociety #BeOurSanta #bakefest

caption: Photo shared by Cheese&Wine Shop Singapore on December 03, 2020 tagging @saintpierresg, and @sgchildrensoc.
description:
Christmas is Love in Action!

Join our Christmas Charity Initiative and stand a chance to win a dinner for 2 in a 2 Michelin stars restaurant and other amazing gifts!

In the month of December La Petite Boutique is donating 10% of all online sales to Singapore Children's Society. Shop with us in December, participate in charity and win a dinner for 2 pax from Chef Emmanuel Stroobant who is offering his signature 8 course menu at Saint Pierre restaurant priced at $348++ per pax. La Petite Boutique is offering a Festive Cheese Platter (valued $148) and 2 online shopping vouchers for $100 and $50. 

All you need to do is to order from our online store for a minimum of $100 from December 4th till December 14th and keep your order number as your lottery ticket. The lucky draw will take place in the shop on December 15th and will be broadcasted live in our IG Story. The more you order, the more are your chances of winning!

Christmas is doing a little extra for someone in need ü§ó

caption: Photo by j. in Singapore with @blessingsinabagasia, @unicef, @foodbanksg, @sgcancersociety, @comchestsg, @thk360, @touchcommunityservices, @sgchildrensoc, @scs.bullyfree.sg, @chcsasg, @calvary.sg, @greensquare.sg, @childrenswishingwell, @casnps, @darulihsansg, @passiton.co, and @dignitymama.
description:
I have a dream. This campaign is part of my dream. The children and youth‚Ä¶ each one of them has a dream. 

And @sgchildrensoc provides a listening ear to support and guide the children and youth through the services they offer.¬†¬†¬† 

One of their programme is ‚ÄòTinkle Friend‚Äô. It is a national toll-free helpline and chatline for all primary school children in Singapore. Manned by trained volunteers and staff, Tinkle Friend provides support, advice and information to lonely and distressed children, especially in situations when their parents or main caregivers are unavailable.

Today, I am committed to make a difference. Will you join me in this journey?

"We buy gifts for our children every Christmas. How about buying a similar gift for a child, the same age as your child? Someone who may not be fortunate enough to celebrate the holiday season and receive a gift. Every year I meet children who are receiving the gifts for the first time in their lives. It is the most remarkable feeling seeing their faces light up with joy when they receive their Boxes of Joy." shares Ms Bipasha Minocha who received the ECF Innovation Award for piloting one of ECF's very first community projects - Box of Joy. 

It was a simple idea, but one that immediately resonated with parents and children. Since then, we have partnered with @etonhouseinternational to collect Boxes of Joy for more than 2,000 beneficiaries every year. Drop us a message if you'd like to contribute a Box of Joy this festive season!

#boxofjoy #christmas2020 #givingback #thegivingstories #givingweeksg @givingweeksg

How do we spark conversations about bullying in a meaningful way?

Scribble Town takes you on a journey with three characters, Sam, Dan and Lydia, who go on a quest to bring colour back into their world. Along the way, Scribble Town hopes to raise awareness of bullying and encourage conversations on ways to deal with this issue. This is a collaboration between Singapore Children‚Äôs Society and the National Heritage Board.

Visit Sun Yat Sen Nanyang Memorial Hall from now till 31 January 2021 to follow along in the journey. Admission is free for Singaporeans and Permanent Residents.

Due to ongoing restrictions, all of Singapore Children‚Äôs Society‚Äôs physical fundraising events this year were cancelled, resulting in reduced donation sources. Compared to previous years, the economic downturn saw fewer corporates coming forward with their support. Not to mention, a surge in the number of families are approaching the organisation to seek help. Some have lost their livelihood or faced salary cuts that threaten their ability to provide for their families.

We (founders) of Revamp Project would like to step up and make a change for the children and youths from vulnerable families who are affected by this pandemic. It is undoubtedly a very bold project for us to undertake, especially when we are just a budding start-up. However, we strongly believe that collective efforts can change lives and that we can make a change for the children. With that, A Dollar Movement, a fundraising campaign was birthed to show our support and let people know that every dollar is still able to make a change. We hope that this movement can bring about a positive change in Singapore, one that hits harder than COVID-19. 

We sincerely hope that you will join us in this movement of change, one that makes a difference for countless lives in Singapore. You too, can make a change simply by signing-off with your name on this post and share it on IG story to show your support in A Dollar Movement. Together, let us rise as beacons of hope. #revamproject #adollarmovement

description:
Singapore Children‚Äôs Society also works with families in need. Some of the support they provide includes casework and counselling. It is normally provided when individuals or families are in crisis or under distress. The goal of the service is to help individuals or families to develop insights into their situations, and better problem-solving and coping methods in handling and resolving their difficulties. Through receiving the service, individuals and families are helped to regain stability and independence.

To raise awareness on bullying and explore how we can all contribute to a bully-free culture, the National Heritage Board has collaborated with Singapore Children's Society to present Scribble Town. ‚úèÔ∏è‚Å†‚†Ä
‚Å†‚†Ä
Scribble Town is an interactive children‚Äôs exhibition that invites visitors to follow Sam, Dan, and Lydia on their quest to fix the mighty Colourwheel to save Scribble Town and bring colour back into their world.‚Å† üåà‚Å†‚†Ä
‚Å†‚†Ä
Through their interactions, visitors will be able to gain a better understanding of the different types of bullying, how and why bullying occurs, as well as the effects of bullying on the victims, those who engage in bullying behaviour, and bystanders.‚Å†‚†Ä
‚Å†‚†Ä

To JOIN the GIVEAWAY (Only for those residing in Singapore üá∏üá¨)

1Ô∏è‚É£ FOLLOW¬†@xueenbakes and @eaterries on Instagram

[REVIEW] 

I can tell you this is a truly Terryfic üëçüèª burnt cheesecake. Instead of a charred, burnt (or chao tar in Hokkien) top, it‚Äôs topped with a sweet caramelised glaze. So for those who don‚Äôt like the carbon (or chao tar) smell and taste in burnt cheesecake, this is for you.

And the highlight is the oozy, creamy centre. Best served chilled, the core is perfectly molten when you take it out of the fridge even if you keep it for two or three days. And the cream cheese is rich and creamy, yet not too sweet or overpowering in cheese flavour. Just right.

[BYKIDO SHARES] Thanks to @nhb_sg for the preview of Scribble Town at @sysnmh
.

If you have a kid in primary school and you have wondered if he was being bullied in sch or is he a bully in sch, this might be a great exhibition for you to start the conversation.
.

Collaborating with @sgchildrensoc, the exhibition raises the issue of bullying in a non-judgemental and kids-friendly manner, helping the kids understand how speech, action and responses can impact others, and how they can protect themselves and others too.
.

Follow the characters of Scribble Town on a quest, and through their interaction, children can gain a better understanding of what is bullying, how and why it happens, and the impact of it on others.
.

And its not only about being bullied but also about being a bully.

The quest ends without a clear bully or bullied. I like how it portrays each character as having been a bully or was bullied. Like in the real world, it's not always black and white.
.

It's a small exhibition but the lessons are big. Take this opportunity to discuss how some words and action might cause hurt to others, even if done unintentionally. Not only have your child reflect on himself but maybe parents too need to reflect on our choice of words and reactions too.
.

Scribble Town is happening at the Sun Yat Sen Nanyang Memorial Hall from now till 31 Jan 2021. Open Tue to Sun (closed Mon) from 10 am to 5 pm.

The exhibition is free to Singaporeans and PRs.
.
.

üåà Giving Back üåà

The year 2020 has been tough. Due to COVID-19 and recession, charities are one of the most badly affected sectors as corporate donations have cut by at least 30% ü•∫

Growing up I didn‚Äôt have much. But I had help from government aid and support from random strangers who gave us food and toys during special occasions like Christmas üéÑ 

I told myself that when I grow up I want to be like them too, giving back to society, particularly to children. I understand what it is like to be from an underprivileged, low-income family, so I can imagine the joy on the children‚Äôs faces when they receive kindness from strangers and most importantly it gives them hope that¬† society cares for their well being ‚ù§Ô∏è

During the circuit breaker, I thought of ways I could contribute to society. I started by¬† volunteering once a week with Meals On Wheels, delivering packed lunch to senior citizens living in rented or single room flats üë¥üèºüëµüèº

However, I always thought that I could do more. With my knowledge and expertise in the financial field, I decided to launch my first webinar on how to start investing for my friends and social media followers. We didn‚Äôt have much time to publicise the webinar much, but with God‚Äôs grace, 30 people signed up and contributed towards the donation to Singapore Children‚Äôs Society (SCS) ü§≤üèª

I was glad that I had helped 30 people to gain the insight and confidence to start investing but more importantly that as a group, we could give back to society in monetary terms. The power of unity is unbelievable, we managed to raise $1,170 üôèüèº

SCS is a prominent organisation that promotes the well-being of children and shares the same core values as I do ; Compassion, Commitment and Integrity ‚ú®

To all the participants of my first webinar, thank you. We couldn‚Äôt have done it without your amazing support. This is for all of us. Most importantly, this is for all the children that deserve a better tomorrow üë¶üèªüßíüèΩüëßüèºüßëüèæ‚Äçü¶±

The pandemic has stopped many things but definitely not child and youth abuse or severe negligence cases in Singapore. In fact, we might be seeing a rise in such cases particularly during these trying times. Thank you to the unsung heroes of Children's Society for protecting and providing care and guidance for the vulnerable children and youth in our community! 

And thank you to our angels who supported our bakes and made this possible! ‚ù§

#bakesg #bakerssg #singaporehomebaker #singaporehomebake #embakessg #singaporehomecooks #fruittarts #childrensociety

As a mom, I believe children learn best when we do not step in to fix their mistakes. Let them dream. Let them play. Fall. Fail. The tower tumbles. Try again. Building resilience by teaching them how to deal with the fallout is crucial. For too many reasons, some children do not receive this parental support. We all know this, but pause to really consider that for a long moment. How blessed we are! Because every child deserves a bright future, I am sure you want to join me in supporting Singapore Children‚Äôs Society.
.
I‚Äôm proud to partner with @avyanna_official to raise funds for @sgchildrensoc. Until the end of June, Avyanna will donate $120, from the sale of each piece of jewelry, directly to the charity to support and protect vulnerable children of all races and religions.

Kudos to Avyanna for launching this fundraiser, during this surreal time. Kudos to any of you who buy and support. You will gain a beautiful piece, while helping a gem of a child.
.
I am wearing the Resilience collection. Swipe to see the stunning pieces.
.
To support, please visit www.avyanna.sg ‚ù§Ô∏è
.
Thank you! ü§ó
.

description: The Singapore Children‚Äôs Society works hard to protect the vulnerable and less fortunate children in Singapore, so that they have equal opportunities to succeed.

caption: Photo shared by The Batter Club & Company on June 13, 2020 tagging @sgchildrensoc.
description:
Introducing our new beneficiary. Many of us are unaware that there are over 17,000 orphans in our society. These children are deprived of familial love from the moment they were born. 
This Father‚Äôs Day, as we express gratitude to our fathers through warm celebrations at home, we hope that we can do something more by supporting Singapore Children‚Äôs Society who serve as parents to these children. We want to thank them for their meaningful work and ensure they can continue to touch even more lives.

description:
üîàWe are adopting the Singapore Children‚Äôs Society as our charitable cause under our CSR program. 
It will be our pleasure if we can contribute a little to relief and give some happiness to children in need. 
Amongst other things, we will collect donations on our website theartofsake.com during checkout. We will match donations dollar for dollar. 
Kanpai! 
#csr #singapore #childrenssociety #singaporechildrenssociety #charity #givingback #giversgain

There are no more spotlights and red carpets, my ballgowns and heels sit forgotten in the closet.  Yet, we can take a moment to dream, while playing our board games, drinking our Dalgona coffee, and in this pause, shine that spotlight on those who may need our help more than ever.
.
Proud to be part of this campaign with homegrown jewellery brand @avyanna_official  Our worlds may be upside down, but we have family, shelter and safety.  Avyanna will be generously donating $120 from each piece of jewellery sold on www.avyanna.sg, to the @sgchildrensoc which will help provide meals, essentials and mental health services to families in need at this time. Please take a moment to dream with us, to support local businesses and power the dreams of others.
.
I‚Äôm wearing the Freedom ear-rings in rose gold with diamonds, and Freedom rings, best worn stacked! Thank you @jessicacindy_official for dressing us all in dream gowns! @mercurysocial
.

Freedom To Dream: Honoured to be part of this campaign with my children. ‚ÄúA Moment To Dream‚Äù is a social project by Avyanna, created in support of Singapore Children‚Äôs Society. 
Life has changed so much this first half of the year for my family. As I reflect on the challenges we have faced and how we must continue to do so with grace & resilience, I‚Äôm grateful that we‚Äôre blessed with freedom to choose how to navigate through the storm. However some are less fortunate; circumstances render them less free to choose. So let us take a moment to think of those who need our help. 
Our campaign raises funds for @sgchildrensoc with @avyanna_official donating $120, from the sale of each piece of jewellery to children in need. Specifically, the money will enable their work in providing meals, counselling and mental health resources for children in vulnerable families. 
To support, please visit www.avyanna.sg, swipe to see a close up of their dreamy Freedom collection jewellery I‚Äôm wearing with this stunning  @jessicacindy_official gown.

Many thanks to campaign partners:  @iampaigeparker @jennytay_9909 @cherylwee @eyedoc_sg @iamyvetteking 
@melissackoh @wantingw & @mercurysocial for pulling it all together.

Singapore Children's Society @sgchildrensoc protects and nurtures children and youth of all races and religions, especially children, youth and families in need. During this #circuitbreaker period, Children‚Äôs Society has seen an increase in the needs of its beneficiaries, and its social workers and counsellors are doing what they can to support them. 
The stress and fear children experience in this #COVID19 situation is real: they may have parents working on the frontline, parents suffering enormous stress because of financial issues or suffering from mental and physical issues, amongst others. Some of them may be vulnerable children living with their caregivers who may abuse them. SWIPE LEFT FOR MORE INFO.  Please make a donation to help these children and in return, you will receive a Thank You gift from us! T&C apply. 
To donate, click on link in bio. 
#SGTogether #sgunited

caption: Photo shared by NYLON SINGAPORE on April 16, 2020 tagging @sgchildrensoc.
description:
Fears of unemployment, domestic abuse, depression and other mental health issues are beginning to surface as people stay home and are apart from others. #COVID19 has changed the way we work and while the social workers at Singapore Children‚Äôs Society can‚Äôt meet up with their beneficiaries, they continue to work hard to reach out virtually to them, and offer various forms of assistance. With the majority of people staying home, we all become less aware of what‚Äôs happening outside. Just because you don‚Äôt see it, doesn‚Äôt mean that it‚Äôs not happening. What we do not see, sometimes calls for our greatest attention. Lend a helping hand to the unseen cries. Support Singapore Children‚Äôs Society and their beneficiaries now: www.childrensociety.org.sg/donation
.
.
@sgchildrensoc
Watch this.

Accepting that we have weaknesses n yet, being confident of the things we r good at. Holding our ground for what we believe in while listening hard 4 criticisms that can help us 2 improve. Perhaps by having those quiet little conversations with ourselves, we will b able 2 truly find peace. Tks @you_yi 4 sharing those valuable nuggets of wisdom wif our youths n... That impromptu pipa performance of cuz! U rock!!! =)
.
.
. 
#Socialwork #youthwork #youth #self #acceptance #confidence #praise #criticism #Iglive

caption: Photo shared by Tjin Lee on April 09, 2020 tagging @awaresingapore, @sgchildrensoc, and @we.are.limitless.
description:
Perhaps we should stop asking ‚ÄúWhere will you go on your next holiday when this is over‚Äù and ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs the first thing you‚Äôll do when this ends‚Äù - and ask instead how we‚Äôre going to help each other get through this. Because life as we know it is over.

In the words of Minister K Shunmugam, expect ‚ÄúEconomic devastation, businesses will close, lives will be ruined.‚Äù ‚ÄúThink Positive‚Äù will soon not be enough. We need to prepare mentally, emotionally and financially for the true crisis to come.

Perhaps business owners have a clearer view of the runway ahead, to see the turbulence on the horizon.  It‚Äôs gut-wrenching watching an Events company I‚Äôve built for 20 years struggle to it knees in months
.
Where we are today, is the calm before the storm. While it‚Äôs important to ‚Äústay positive‚Äù, we must also become pragmatic. Can you expect to survive without 6 months or more without any income? Many Singaporeans can‚Äôt, and it‚Äôs time to figure out how we‚Äôre really going to ‚Äúget through this together‚Äù. Not just by dreaming of our next holiday, or the first thing  we‚Äôll do after.

It‚Äôs time for all those who are able, to pull someone else up. Send groceries to a friend who is struggling, call out a neighbour‚Äôs domestic violence @awaresingapore help a child in need @sgchildrensoc become mental health ambassadors @we.are.limitless  We can each do something, however small.
.
In a short while, the half of society that can help, will have to uplift the half that needs help. This is not the time to attack ‚Äúprivilege‚Äù but to accept that we‚Äôre all suffering in our own ways. Be kind, don‚Äôt judge, help others, be a good neighbour, take care of your mental health. This is the only way we‚Äôre all going to survive this together.
.
‚ÄúThere is a mysterious cycle in human events. To some generations much is given. Of other generations much is expected. This generation... has a rendezvous with destiny.‚Äù
- Franklin D Roosevelt (in the midst of the Great Depression 1933)
.
#SGunited #fightcovid19 #coronavirus #sgmum #bekind #mentalhealthawareness #staystrong

description:
When the world as we know it is turned upside down, our initial response is freeze, fight, or flight. When we realise there is nothing to fight, and nothing to run away from, we can take a moment to pause. Silence. Observe. What truths can we hold? Breathe in. Where can we create space to accept the new? Breathe out. New breath, new light.

description:
Our usual first half of the year is always lined up with lots of family events. Many many families members‚Äô birthdays which are the happy ones, not so happy  but yet heart warming ones ; tomb sweeping which is part of our chinese culture and a good time for family bonding too ‚Å£
‚Å£
But now......we all need to abide to the law and be social responsible for nothing more than 10 person gathering here in Singapore and any mass meet up events are all cancelled.‚Å£
‚Å£
It can be quite tough for some when school had started to slowly keep once a day in a week for home learning, pte learning Centre closed and school outings are gone as well
‚Å£
On the other hand,  we deeply believed only with all these safety measures and cooperation we will then to be in a better control of covid19 ‚Å£that is still currently spreading like wild fire
‚Å£
At this point of time , it‚Äôs crucial and real that one to keep a positive mind. So, meanwhile I keep my calm and carry on practicing my many years ago of hand stand. Namaste üôèüèª‚Å£
‚Å£
‚Å£
‚Å£

Our uniqueness is a gift to ourselves. This special qualities can help one to be the best version of yourself.‚Å£

description:
Where does the money raised through #YogaForHope go to?
.
The funds raised will go directly to the 4 youth centres of Singapore Children‚Äôs Society to help support developmental programmes for youth in the community who predominantly come from lower income families with multiple social issues. The lack of opportunities and resources have often placed them at a disadvantage comparatively to peers their age.
.
The youth centres provide therapeutic interventions to help positively develop values in the youth, focusing on their strengths and potential whilst providing them with the opportunities and resources to become the best versions of themselves.
.
Help make their social impact sustainable by being a part of our movement. Sign up at the link in our bio today.
.
#OBWSG #OBW2020 #StretchForACause #SocialCause #SocialGood #SocialImpact #YogaSG #YogaForHope #Fitness #FitnessSG #StrongerTogether

caption: Photo shared by Tjin Lee on October 28, 2019 tagging @sgchildrensoc. May be an image of child and standing.
description:
What does it feel like to have no money? I was at the airport last week when I discovered I had left my wallet at home.
.
I was meeting a friend on the flight, so decided to just hang with the boys. We went to the public playground and drank from the water fountain. The boys wanted to buy toys, I told them they could window shop. Jake wanted juice, I said we didn‚Äôt have money.  Forget about food. We found all status revoked, no lounge access, all my cards gone. Without identity and status, we were not welcome, had no options, in a place surrounded by people who had means. Not having money can be the most disempowering feeling in the world. If even for a brief moment, I felt like someone else.
.
I felt helpless, trapped, compromised. One kindly lady saw me sitting with the two boys watching airplanes take off, Jake begging for orange juice. She smiled at us, and I suppose if I had asked, she would have bought us a juice. But there it was - that sense of utter helplessness, of not being able to fend for oneself. Over time, it could chip away at your self-worth and dignity, and trap you in a downward cycle of poverty and failure. This is an incredibly difficult topic to tackle in Singapore, where the class divide cuts sharper than race, language or religion. Poverty can befall a family, swiftly, unexpectedly, with the death or illness of a sole breadwinner or sudden unemployment.

My friend arrived, we bought toys and orange juice. We boarded the plane and took off. But I couldn‚Äôt shake off the sense of profound helplessness and disempowerment. There are people living in Singapore who have to make a choice each month whether to buy groceries or pay for utilities. They live on as little as $3.30 a day for food. It may be shocking to think that there are those in desperate need living among us.
.
What if no one had come to our rescue? What if it were not an hour, but for a lifetime? Can we do more than buy a juice for a stranger in need, trapped in circumstance? Most heartbreaking of all, not being able to provide for my hungry children.  How can we help?
.
#endpoverty #livebelowtheline 
Link in my profile @sgchildrensoc

[SEXUAL ABUSE]

As a #parent, I endeavour to equip and empower my son (and all my biological/#fosterchildren) with knowledge on #bodyawareness/smart, understanding #touch and #bodyprivacy, personal boundaries, #respect, #consent, and all those along the line of #bodysafety education. 
There is nothing awkward about it. 
We have been having these conversations and stories are such a fantastic resource. 
_

Here‚Äôs what I do: 
1. Read books on body safety education and sexual abuse. 
2. Have conversations around them (Reinforce: importance on taking care of body, secrets about touching aren‚Äôt good) 
3. Empower my kids with skills and strategies when faced with touchy situations. üëá

_

Skills/Strategies when faced with touchy situations (curated by @sgchildrensoc): 1. Say NO 
2. Walk OUT
3. Tell a TRUSTED adult 
_

I will post more books on this topic in my stories. Will create a highlight for it too. May it be of benefit to all, inshaAllah. 
Picture: Local picture book on sexual abuse by @sgchildrensoc 
News reference: 
https://www.todayonline.com/singapore/teaching-children-about-body-safety-call-genitals-proper-terms-start-experts-advise

Resource: 
https://www.childrensociety.org.sg/resources/ck/files/Kidzlive%20Booklet%202018.pdf 
#readingwithummi

caption: Photo shared by Nur'afifah on September 19, 2019 tagging @sgchildrensoc.
description:
Body safety awareness is a skill and knowledge that every child should be equipped with. Children should know how to protect themselves and identify when encounters are crossing the permissable boundaries. While we often educate children on stranger danger, we have come to an age where it is extremely important to also educate them on body safety as unfortunately, as incredulous as it may be, sexual abuse often times happen with the people they trust. It is heartbreaking seeing this happening and it is a need to begin educating as early as possible to protect our young children from falling victims to such predators. ‚Å£
‚Å£
This #kidlit addresses this #bodyawareness issue in way that is relatable and easy for children to comprehend. It shows the sequence of how the abuse happen - through befriending and teaching the child to having baths and inappropriate touches. The book also struck me that as parents we also need to be conscious and aware of the behavioural changes in our children and to intervene when behaviour changes are portrayed. ‚Å£
‚Å£
This book carries such an important message for both adults and children. We need more of such books to help educate the society so that such occurances can be prevented. May our children always be protected. ‚Å£
‚Å£
#kidlit #childrensliterature #childrensbooks #picturebooks #diversebooks #bodyawareness #sexualabuse #prevention #protectourchildren

Working with Innervate Fitness as our official CrossFit partner for the disadvantaged youth we work with in the community has been truly a blessing. We couldn‚Äôt ask for a better partner in delivering high quality coaching that is in line with our therapeutic directions.
.
Lionel and his team of coaches bring to the table not only an extensive knowledge in the discipline of CrossFit, but are also terrific in engaging young people to enjoy the wonderful sport. This unique approach in coaching youth allows a holistic collaboration between our therapists and the coaches to develop positive values in youth to becoming the best versions of themselves.
.
Here‚Äôs wishing them a happy 5th birthday and to higher grounds of success!
- Singapore Children‚Äôs Society (SCS), Partner
#FacesOfInnervate

Making a difference is better done together and we‚Äôre so thankful to have had the opportunity to collaborate with various organisations to extend our impact. These organisations include but are not limited to UA, Again Faster, Far East Organisation, Queenstown Secondary, RCSS, NYC and MCCY.
.
From youth programs to corporate gigs to classes for the elderly, it‚Äôs all about forging elite lives and making people better. 3 years later, we‚Äôre glad to say we‚Äôre still working with most of the same organisations and many more!
.

Last Sunday, the ThinkCrate team supported the Walk for Our Children 2019 organized by the Singapore Children‚Äôs Society. 
It was a fun-filled day with diverse booths and exciting performances for all to enjoy. 
Children, adults, and even the elderly unleashed their competitive spirit while competing in our Whack-a-Mole and Reaction games!

We are glad we could be part of such a meaningful event!

Our children went entrepreneurial by getting involved in the production of our #upcycled items, creating the posters and even had a say in pricing! So here‚Äôs a BIG THANK YOU to everyone who had patronised our booths! You‚Äôve put a smile on our faces and your actions have made the Earth a little more sustainable to live in. All of you have made a difference and we appreciate it!
.

On 13 July, #youths from our VOX cafe collaborated with visually impaired guides from @dialogue.sg to serve beneficiaries from Filos Community Services. It was the first time the youths got to work with the visually impaired which challenged them but they overcame that challenge to make service and communication easier for all. She showed teeth when others of her own kind get near her but she is so ever ready with two legged humans. So Home is her favourite place but not dog park. ‚Å£

1000m row
100 kb swings
60 burpees over bar
100 goblet squats
60 barbell push press
---
Super proud of this bunch for pushing through the pain/jet lag/lack of sleep/fatigue and working hard together in completing @mettlechallenge 2019! Thank you to our @thehighpanterssg cheer squad for keeping us going!
---
Started by Round Box, Mettle Challenge is a charity fitness event which supports and raises funds for 4 youth centres under Singapore Children's Society. As participants and spectators, let's never forget the true meaning of these events even when the competitive fire in us burn strong. #ChallengeForTheirDreams

Our staff at #SingaporePools have championed various causes ‚Äì from engaging disadvantaged children & youths to befriending elderly and caring for the environment through ‚Äì iShine (I Serve from the Heart and In Nurturing Everyone). This movement of care for the community has held a strong track record since 2003.

Today #SingaporePools celebrates our 51st Anniversary (yes it‚Äôs our Birthday!), and we celebrate this milestone with our iShine heroes who have gone beyond the extra mile for the community. Special thanks also to our iShine beneficiaries who have journeyed with us, and giving us the opportunity to serve alongside their dedicated teams to touch lives and make a difference!
