18 Feb 19 [f4yo] :: ‚ÄúHi May! We are organising a charity art drive and are looking for parent and child duos to come in for an art jamming session. Your art piece will be put on auction and all proceeds will be donated to @sgchildrensoc. Will Faye and you be keen?‚Äù .
.
Of Course! Faye would be delighted to do more art sessions on top of her usual once a week at #dalittleartsschool and I had always wanted to do something with her. It will be a great opportunity to bond over something as therapeutic as art with my child. .
.
Ewan came along and wow was it challenging to work on one artwork with three different ideas! #fayefayeÂ¶πÂ¶π chose to paint this picture of two trees entwined by their branches to form the share of a heart. Ewan wanted another more masculine picture. They argued about pink sky and orange sky. They argued about who should paint which side of the canvas. Oh gosh! The other moms at the same art jamming session saw it with their own eyes. We were engaged more in a family fight as opposed to a family bonding session.
.
They eventually agreed on a midnight sky and Ewan helped with the background before he decided to go play on his own, leaving Faye and I to complete our painting. Ah‚Ä¶. Might as well. .
.
I was worried when Faye chose one of the hardest picture to paint. I‚Äôm that C art student in school. So really, I was utterly impressed with our final outcome because it looked really nice! .
.
Faye was meticulous with imprinting those flowers on the branches and there was a moment when she went overboard and painted flowers on the trunk too. I let out a laugh, ‚Äúhahahaha Faye! Trunks don‚Äôt flower! We have to put them on branches!‚Äù I didn‚Äôt know how to correct those but the amazing teachers at school showed me how to do corrections with paint! I was so impressed and it definitely boosted my confidence in art when one of you DM me to say you would love to auction for it and have it hung in your living room! .
.
This may turn embarrassing because none of you may respond to this but let‚Äôs try! .
.
Comment below [just for fun] with the first comment as the starting bid and following comments with a higher offer! Let‚Äôs see how much we can ‚Äúraise‚Äù!

description:
‚ÄúI feel excited as it‚Äôs my first major CrossFit event that i will be participating [in]. I will continue to train hard and do it to the best of my potential. Let‚Äôs bring the challenge on for something good!‚Äù
- Hazim, 18 years old, Youth Member of RoundBox @ Children‚Äôs Society
.
OBW is not just a passive fundraising event, instead it is a movement which actively engages and empowers our youth beneficiaries by encouraging them to take part as participants or volunteers.
.
Hazim has a goal - to give his best and use his #FitnessForACause. Are you up for the challenge too?
.
#OBWStoryOfHope #OBWFightsForHope #OBW2019 #OBWSG #PowerToEmpower #SocialGood #SocialImpact #CrossFit #CrossFitSG #FitnessMotivation #StrongerTogether

description:
The youths are at the heart of what we do at OBW. Youths at risk, forgotten youths ‚Äì whatever you may call them, these are the youths who have been disregarded and misunderstood by society. Every youth has potential and will be the generation of our future, so why should their circumstances define them? With OBW, we hope to help these youths spread their wings and empower them to be the best that they can be, giving them the support and encouragement they need. To date, we have managed to impact the lives of over 800 youths. Join us as we Fight For Hope and make a difference in the lives of these youths ‚Äì your small actions can go a long way. .
#OBWFightsForHope #FightForHope #OBW2019 #CrossFit #CrossFitSg #Fitness #FitnessForACause #FitnessSg #Community #SocialGood #Charity

Here is a drill to introduce movement for beginner tennis players. You can either feed them the ball by throwing it with your hand or using your racket or drop it for the trainee like I am doing in the video ‚úåüèΩüëèüèΩ
.
.
Introducing the sport and technical aspect can be quite static for the first session or two so it's important to add in fun movement drills as a warm up. After the basic technique and ball hitting has been established, you can start adding in movement drills like the above in the video üòä
.
.
Don't be too strict or worried about how they run around at the beginning as the idea is to get the child to be more active and to have fun üòÅüòÅ

description: Between serving patients at Family Health Chiropractic Clinic and running with Tiger the #RunnerDog, I was blessed to volunteer at @roundboxcentre (youth centre for teens to develop holistically through therapeutic sports and art intervention) to share with and inspire up and coming runner @naydhan_r_15. The High Panters are built upon a core value of building communities, so when the opportunity came to be part of The Mettle Challenge, we had to jump in.
‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
Organised by the good folks from @roundboxcentre for @sgchildrensoc, the event aimed to raise funds and awareness for youth in need, and also allowed us to meet new and old friends from the local fitness community. Using a secret carbo-loading formula involving durians and alcohol, we pushed, threw, jumped and lifted our way to take pole position in the Invitational Team Category!
‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
Congrats to the organisers, volunteers, participants and beneficiaries - all the true winners at The Mettle Challenge 2018.
#TheHighPanters
#adidasSG
#ChallengefortheirDreams

caption: Photo by Ervin Lim in Singapore Sports Hub with @marccheww, @geniemule, @roundboxcentre, @cheekadeechinadechinesechicken, @sgchildrensoc, @mettlechallenge, and @thehighpanterssg.
description:
We thought we were screwed for this challenge, but we surprised ourselves and ended up taking home the win! Shout out to @roundboxcentre and @sgchildrensoc for having us for the invitational team @mettlechallenge. It was such an inspiration seeing the beneficiaries rip through the workout in wave 1. Really set the tone for us to give our 110%. #ChallengeForTheirDreams
---
Couldn't have wished for better teammates in @thehighpanterssg for their continued encouragement throughout! #TheHighPanters #AdidasSG

Sometimes hosting is not just a mere show/gig.
It's an opportunity to rekindle relationships  through a worthy cause: üòäThank u Singapore Children's Society for entrusting me with this important task again.
It felt warm & fuzzy when Chairman Mr Koh told me (while on stage)" It's good to have you back again"
.
üòäIt's heartening to see DPM Teo Chee Hean again as the Patron of 1000E and 1000 Philanthropists for Children-in-need Programme ...and of coz his SO who was often amused with me
.
üòäAfter having met many of the generous philanthropists at various events, friendships were forged. And to have Philanthropist Jason Tang got up frm his seat just to walk up and said "Hi" to me was such an honour. His humble demeanor is a virtue & reminder for myself.
.
üòä Meeting old friend/ "comrade" @keweitay & bouncing ideas off each other for betterment of our segments was always appreciated. We love what we do‚úå
.
.
.
.

caption: Photo shared by KIDSCRAFTER on February 06, 2018 tagging @sgchildrensoc.
description:
This festive season, we are giving back to society! Since our launch last year, we have received much love from everyone - whether it's from our valued customers or brand reps. We feel very, very blessed which is why we have decided to share the happiness!
.
Our Petite Hearts Print Sleeveless Dress in Candy Red has been very well-loved by all of you and it has been our all-time best seller. In the spirit of a giving heart, we have decided that for every piece of this dress sold from 6 February 2018 to 8 March 2018, $10 will be donated to Singapore Children's Society. Customers who bought this dress will also receive a Thank You card specially drawn by the beneficiaries of Children's Society.
.
Established in 1952, Singapore Children‚Äôs Society is a voluntary welfare organisation with a mission to protect and nurture children, youth and families in need regardless of their background. We hope to raise as much money as we can to give them a big red packet this year.
.
At Kidscrafter, we always believe that price should not affect the quality of a child's wellbeing. With this fundraiser, we hope to do a little to improve their quality of wellbeing.
.
On our part, Kidscrafter will also be providing free local shipping with no minimum purchase. Don‚Äôt worry, we have worked it out with our courier to ensure your parcel of happiness will definitely reach you in 2 days‚Äô time. We hope you will share our giving spirit this festive season. Be the heart that gives. Share the happiness.
.
Our sincere thank you for all your generosity.
.
*Only applicable for purchases made online.

caption: Photo shared by Mettle Challenge on November 14, 2017 tagging @roundboxcentre, and @sgchildrensoc.
description:
Meet Naydhan, member of the RoundBox Athletics team and challenger for the upcoming Mettle Challenge. In the beginning, Naydhan never believed that he could accomplish physical feats such as running and fitness - but after committing to training and completing his first 5K run (which he clocked a time of 22mins), he started to see that vast potential that exists within him. Today, Naydhan is training hard to take part in the Mettle Challenge and is determined to do his very best for the challenge. Join him and the other youths on the 9th Dec to take on the #ChallengeForTheirDreams. 
#MettleChallenge #fitnesssg #fitnessforacause #crossfitsg #roundbox #singaporechildrensociety

caption: Photo shared by Amazing Trekkers Club on September 27, 2017 tagging @anisury, @cat_mother_of_hounds, @skainee, @sisugirls, @poconido, @tanglintrust, @sgchildrensoc, @hazzledazzlepan, and @soletosoulforkids. May be an image of one or more people, people standing and indoor.
description:
Cheque Presentation to the Singapore Children's Society took place at their headquarters represented by founders of Amazing Trekkers Club (Hazleen Panayiotou) and Poco Nido (Catherine Lobley), 2 junior ambassadors of Sole to Soul and students of Tanglin Trust School (Zoe Panayiotou and Anya Birch) and Logistics Director of ATC Ani Ahmad. We are so pleased our joint project #climbfuji  was a beautiful success with both Anya and Zoe successfully climbed Mount Fuji (3775m) in May with Amazing Trekkers Club. A month before the trek they began fundraising activities for 3 Organizations in the UK and Singapore. The charities in the UK are BulliesOut - Working with the Bullied, Bully and Bystander and Children with Cancer UK.

Although they aimed to raise $3000, with the support of family, friends members and staff of ATC and Poco Nido, they raised a whopping $7000. Congratulations to both girls for pushing their limits and for practising the virtues of kindness, compassion and perseverance. We are so proud of them both and have had a brainstorming session on our next charity project together. Zoe and Anya welcome other junior ambassadors to work alongside them and Tanglintrust School students to join them on their next adventure! #pushinglimits #climbfuji #soletosoul #forchildren #climbmountains #resilience #determination #grit #notglory #caringforthefuture #tanglintrustschool #amazingtrekkersclub #poconido

caption: Photo by Poco Nido in Tiong Bahru Plaza with @sgchildrensoc, @amazingtrekkersclub, and @soletosoulforkids.
description: What an amazing afternoon. A journey full circle. Yesterday I went as part of #soletosoul to present the cheque for the money raised on our #climbfuji project. üëèüèºIn this photo you can see team #soletosoul üí™üèº @hazzledazzlepan @skainee @catherine_poconido and Junior ambassadors Anya and Zoe. We all climbed mount Fuji in July, the girls -supported by #poconido and @amazingtrekkersclub were sponsored by family and friends, and raised a total of $7000 üôåüèºüóª üáØüáµ Half of that was passed to the Children's Society of Singapore yesterday. The rest will be presented to #bulliesout and #childrenwithcanceruk next month. I feel so blessed to be part of this joint project, it polishes the soul to give something back. ‚ô•Ô∏è On our site we have a page where you can read all about Sole to Soul. We're currently cooking up our next project and will share details soon. üòú #payitforward #kidshelpingkids #volunteer #causes #donate #change #activism #dogood #charity #nonprofit #fundraising #socialgood #raisingstronggirls

While prepping for my presentations, I stumbled upon old pictures in my computer and coincidentally look what I found! Almost 4 years ago I painted a mural for a primary school in ChiangMai and today, here I am again doing what I love, volunteering and painting! This time with another group of lovely ladies and for the @sgchildrensoc at Sunbeam place. It means so much when Im given the opportunity to spread joy with art and I know its going to mean so much more for the children at Sunbeam ‚ù§ thank you @sgturfclub and @missuniversesingapore for organizing this amazing project. Ans well done ladies, I hope our hardwork puts a smile on the childrens faces! #emilcountsherluckystars #missuniversesingapore2017 #missuniverse2017

caption: Photo shared by Sole To Soul on July 16, 2017 tagging @bulliesoutuk, @cwc_uk_events, and @sgchildrensoc.
description:
#Repost @sisugirls
„Éª„Éª„Éª
Zoe, pictured left, is one of Singapore's original SisuGirls. Last week the gutsy 9-year-old joined her mother & a team of climbers from @amazingtrekkersclub to the summit of Japan's Mt Fuji. Zoe was joined on the trek by 8-year-old Anya and they were raising funds for children affected by cancer and bullying. The Sole to Soul Climb was very much outside the girls comfort zone and a great lesson in teamwork and the importance of appreciating the environment and the challenges faced by others.

description:
We all need someone who inspires us to do better than we know how. Thank you @anisury. üíô maybe one day we will climb Mount Everest just like you. #Repost @anisury
„Éª„Éª„Éª
This girl, Zoe and her friend, Anya are 2 amazing children who have the vision to climb mountains for a cause and that is for children with cancer and to stand up against bullying. How amazing right? They are only 9 and 8 years old. And so, Zoe summitted Mt Fuji very recently and I felt so proud of her. 
If this doesn't inspire all of us out there to keep being active and also to spare a thought for others, i dont know what will. 
And if you are inspired, do help them raise funds for their cause. Check out their Instagram space to find out more @soletosoulforkids 
#inspirationalchildren #rolemodel

caption: Photo shared by YMCA Youth For Causes (YFC) on March 24, 2017 tagging @sgchildrensoc.
description:
My YFC journey has been daunting, exciting and exhausting but very much worthwhile. Two years on, I am still filled with fond memories and wonderful friendships; I still actively bring what've we learnt during our implementation period to the events I help organize today. But my most memorable moments lie in my experiences and responses to our project initiatives. 
Carrying out Operation KIWI, in support for Singapore Children's Society (SCS), gave me a lot of faith. Time and time again, I witnessed our volunteers bring so much energy and joy into their roles. 
Streetsales were tiring, from logistical arrangements to the long hours on the ground, but the kindness of many Singaporeans helped bolster our spirits. We've had strangers come up to us to thank us or buy our volunteers drinks, or simply take the initiative to find out more about Operation KIWI. "A little goes a long way" sounds hackneyed and trite, but we've never understood the value of our small efforts until we saw our coins amass into larger sums and such valuable funding for SCS. To be able to create tangible impact, and to do so with others that share your spirit has been an extraordinary opportunity, and I am grateful for that chance. ~Chelsia Low, YFC 2015 Operation Kiwi, YFC 2016/2017 Alumni Committee #YFC2017 #Makeyourmark

description:
Congratulations to Singapore Children‚Äôs Society, Peicai Secondary School, and Powerhouse CABIN members on the launch of the 27th Project CABIN! Happy to see students working together to create a fun and positive space to hang out with friends ‚Äì one that is uniquely their own. Glad to know the shared CABIN experience has strengthened the bonds between them. I hope to see more common spaces being built to forge deeper bonds between youths from diverse backgrounds, where all can feel at home. 
#projectCABIN #pcss

description: The whole of MyBox crew had fun today celebrating an early Christmas party for Singapore's Children Society @sgchildrensoc along with *SCAPE! We would like to specially thank our amazing crew @suzannechee @elijahtedng @almous.png @karenhisladyyy_ @tiffanyyeownh @woonchye @gracecmy for putting so much effort in the event as well as @scapesg for the amazing support. description:
Guest hosting the very first Diplomatic Charity Bazaar, in aid of the Singapore Children's Society and The Straits Times School Pocket Money Fund. So far, I've had Nasi Lemak from Malaysia, a Cortado (espresso with milk) from Colombia and wine from Chile. There are 44 embassies here all doing their bit for the children. Come one come all!!! It's happening till 3pm. 
Thanks to Hugo Boss for my dress. #DipCharitySG üì∑: @darkknight83 
#angelatwork #angelsworld #charity #hugoboss #shangrila #lovemyjob #hugobosssg

description:
Rocking my new haircut at the dry run for tomorrow's SG50 Diplomatic Charity Bazaar. 
If you ain't doing much, it'll be at the Shangri-la from 10am to 3pm and involves 44 embassies (first time ever that so many have come together) and all proceeds will go to the Straits Times School Pocket Money Fund and the Singapore Children's Society. 
Great time to shop for Christmas! #DipCharitySG #angelatwork #angelsworld #charity #Friday #friyay #lovemyjob #Singapore #straitstimes #schoolpocketmoneyfund #stschoolpocketmoneyfund #singaporechildrensociety

caption: Photo shared by Derrick Ong on June 12, 2015 tagging @roundboxcentre, @vmoda, @builttoroll, @nativeinstruments, @electricfamily, @drewnilon, and @sgchildrensoc.
description:
Giving back to the community is what I strongly believe in, this is the second time I'm back at the @roundboxcentre and this time I was teaching these underprivileged kids, the basics of music production on a DAW(Digital Audio workstation) while my homie @djplake taught them the basics of Djing.

Who knows one of them would be a dj/producer of the future.

I will be starting a project to help these kids further, if any #dj #producer out there have used equipments that you guys/girls out there wanna give to them, do let me know.

description:
We are giving back to our local communities: Singapore Children Society, Cat welfare society and Touch Young Arrows. 
Simply drop your drink tab into one of the three glass jar and support a local charity. 
Every month we will donate $300 to the group of with most drinks tabs and $100 each to the other 2 groups.
